name: Dennis MacAlistair Ritchie
about: He created the C programming language. He also co-created the UNIX operating system. He received numerous awards, amongst which is the Turing Award.
quote: UNIX is very simple, it just needs a genius to understand its simplicity.

name: Aaron Swartz
about: Programmer, hacktivist, and political organizer, he worked on markdown, RSS, and Reddit. He’s inducted posthumously for the Internet Hall of Fame.
quote: Creativity comes from applying things you learn in other fields to the field you work in.

name: Donald Ervin Knuth
occupation: computer scientist, mathematician, and professor emeritus
about: Computer scientist, mathematician, and retired professor at Stanford University. Creator of TeX, METAFONT, and contributor to theoretical computer science.
quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil

name: Tim Berners-Lee
occupation: Professorial Fellow of Computer Science at the University of Oxford
fields: The inventor of the World Wide Web
about: Sir Timothy is a computer scientist known for developing World Wide Web. He worked on the implementation of HTTP and made his way into the World Wide Web Hall of Fame.
quote: The Web as I envisaged it, we have not seen it yet. The future is still so much bigger than the past

name: Bjarne Stroustrup
occupation: Danish computer scientist, most notable for the creation and development of the C++
fields: the inventor of the World Wide Web
about: A Danish computer scientist is known for creating C++. He was involved in the creation, evolution, and first implementation.
quote: There are only two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses.

name: Linus Torvalds
occupation: the distributed version control system Git and the scuba dive logging and planning software Subsurface
fields: developer of the Linux kernel, used by Linux distributions
about: He is the main developer of the Linux kernel, honored with the 2012 Millenium Technology Prize, and creator of Git.
quote: Bad programmers worry about the code. Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships.

name: Guido van Rossum
occupation: the Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI), Van Rossum wrote and contributed a glob() routine to BSD Unix
fields: The creator of the Python programming language
about: A Dutch programmer, author of Python, and Mondrian, a coding review system for Google.
quote: If you decide to design your own language, there are thousands of sort of amateur language designer pitfalls.

name: James Gosling
occupation: Gosling was elected a member of the National Academy of Engineering in 2004 for the conception and development of the architecture for the Java
fields: designer behind the Java programming language
about: Creator of Java programming language. Developer of NEWS, PostScript interpreter, the first version of Emacs for UNIX, and telemetry for satellites.
quote: Java is C++ without the guns, clubs and knives.

name: Richard Stallman
nationality: New York City, New York, US
occupation: Stallman launched the GNU Project, founded the Free Software Foundation, developed the GNU Compiler Collection and GNU Emacs, and wrote the GNU General Public License.
fields: Free software movement,GNU,GNU Emacs,GNU Compiler Collection,GNU General
about: Founder of Free Software Foundation, GPL license, and other GNu projects. Considered the father of the open-source movement.
quote: Sharing is good, and with digital technology, sharing is easy.

name: Brian Kernighan
occupation: contributed to the development of Unix alongside Unix creators Ken Thompson and Dennis Ritchie. Kernighan's name became widely known through co-authorship of the first book on the C programming language
fields: contributed to the development of Unix
about: Contributor to UNIX, alongside Ken Thompson and Dennis Ritchie. Widely known for his book on C, “C Programming Language”.
quote: Don’t comment bad code — rewrite it

name: Grace Murray Hopper
occupation: Hopper was the first to devise the theory of machine-independent programming languages, and the FLOW-MATIC programming language she created using this theory was later extended to create COBOL, an early high-level programming language still in use today.
fields: Pioneer of computer programming who invented one of the first linkers.
about: Computer pioneer and naval officer. One of the first modern programmers. Worked on programming, developing the manual, and punching machine instructions for Mark I.
quote: A ship in port is safe, but that’s not what ships are built for.

name: Alan Kay
occupation: American computer scientist. He has been elected a Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences, the National Academy of Engineering, and the Royal Society of Arts.[2]
fields: Pioneering work on object-oriented programming and windowing graphical user interface (GUI) design
about: Co-founder of PARC, Palo Alto Research Center, developer of Smalltalk, and Ethernet. Worked in Atari, and on developing a project ARPANet, later known as the Internet.
quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
